AVSEC Order  No.23 /2011 
Subject: - AVSEC Training Courses  and   Refresher Training Course. 
In exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 1934, 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification No. 
1797 dated         July 3, 1997, Commissioner of Security(Civil Aviation), Bureau of Civil 
Aviation Security for  the purpose of  securing aircraft operations directs that : 
(i) 
Necessary AVSEC training shall be imparted  to the concerned employees of 
airlines who are responsible to conduct pre-flight anti-sabotage check which 
inter-alia include the following aspect : 
“Ensure that passengers disembarking at any time do not leave items on 
board the aircraft”. 
(ii) 
Training will also be imparted to airline customer service staff who are 
responsible for authorizing hold baggage for carriage in the aircraft. 
(i) 
A
ll the national security auditors and instructors trained by the BCAS shall undergo 
refresher training course as stipulated in the NCASTP.  
 
2. 
This AVSEC Order shall  be implemented  with immediate effect. Any 
violation of this AVSEC Order shall attract penalty under section 11 A of the  Aircraft 
Act, 1934. 
 
 
(Gurjot Singh Malhi, IPS) 
Commissioner of Security (CA)
